official-title.#text:
To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to authorize a
		  bipartisan majority of Commissioners of the Federal Communications Commission
		  to hold nonpublic collaborative discussions, and for other
		  purposes.

text.#text: Commissioners of the

text.#text: The principal purpose of

Commissioners have relied primarily on an
			 inefficient combination of written messages, communications among staff, and a
			 series of meetings restricted to 2 Commissioners at each such meeting to
			 discuss complex telecommunications matters pending before the

Extensive use of such methods of
			 communication has harmed collegiality and cooperation at the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for years, and continued inaction on these issues
			 has the potential to hinder innovation and private investment in the domestic
			 communications industry.

text.#text:
Numerous regulatory matters have been
			 pending before the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
must be able to work more
			 collaboratively and efficiently than in the past to meet the current challenge
			 of expanding broadband Internet access to the extent necessary to serve the
			 business, educational, health, and cultural needs of all people in the United
			 States.
